metadata.title: CVE-2021-2020 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: Optimizer). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.20 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 6.5 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-2020` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-client - 8.0.21-1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-router - 8.0.21-1
mysql-server - 8.0.21-1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.21-1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
No subscription required

notes.note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.21-1').
